page.title: 18WHAT I DID FOR DOOMSDAY 1985
page.content: We heard that Norman Gibbon wrote poems about Brandon so we went to his house.He was getting ready for work but gave us 2 peoms.One was about the Durham Miner's Gala and the other about the local leak show.We then went to the Co-op to ask David some questions.We asked him if they got a lot of customers and which were the busiest days.Thursday,Friday and Saturday were the busiest.He said 99% of people were not snappy but it depends if you are polite to them. David has worked at the Co-op for almost 7 years and he enjoys his job. There are lots of store thefts but there are 7 store detectives. Children mostly stole sweets but adults went for anything from tinned foods to chickens. __SARAH COWIE 2N.
